content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x cubed, plus 1, and denominator the square root of x squared, plus x, end root, end fraction. " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 2 comma 8, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be the value of the right Riemann sum approximation for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> using 3 intervals of equal length. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="R sub 3, equals, 103.385 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>103.385</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R sub 3, equals, 103.385 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>103.385</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R sub 3, equals, 216.952 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>216.952</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R sub 3, equals, 216.952 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>216.952</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="R sub 3, equals, 216.952 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>216.952</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 8, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
